marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia reported that broad money (M2) in September 2025 grew 8% year-on-year to 9,771.3 trillion rupiah, up from a 7.6% YoY increase in August 2025. The increase was driven by narrow money (M1) growth of 10.7% YoY and quasi-money growth of 6.2% YoY. Bloomberg reported that Danantara hired two former GIC investment professionals, Daniel Lim and Weihan Wong, as investment directors to cover the global private market, focusing initially on opportunities in Indonesia. The United States announced new sanctions targeting Russia's two largest oil companies, Rosneft and Lukoil, a day after President Donald Trump said a planned meeting with President Vladimir Putin in Budapest would be postponed indefinitely. Indonesia's Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa said the government does not plan to raise BPJS Health premiums in 2026, but may consider it if the economy grows above 6%. He also announced that around 20 trillion rupiah has been set aside to write off BPJS Health arrears. Jembo Cable Company (JECC) plans a share buyback of approximately 29.5 billion rupiah between 23 October and 5 December 2025, buying back all shares held by Fujikura Asia Limited (about 6.49% of total shares). Impack Pratama Industri (IMPC) announced a partnership with PT Marubeni Indonesia and PT DNP Indonesia to develop a plastic waste processing project that will turn plastic waste into environmentally friendly building materials.

tickerNews.title: UNVR 9M25 Net Profit +11% YoY, Beats Estimate
tickerNews.content: Unilever Indonesia (UNVR) recorded net profit of 1.18 trillion rupiah in 3Q25 (+117% YoY, +28% QoQ). This brings 9M25 net profit to 3.34 trillion rupiah (+11% YoY), equal to 77% of the 2025 consensus estimate. The company shows potential to exceed the 2025 consensus estimate based on the run-rate from 1Q25. Revenue grew 12% YoY in 3Q25, the first annual increase since 3Q23, with an 8% QoQ rise, matching 1Q25 levels. Underlying volume in the domestic market rose 10% YoY, with the Home & Personal Care segment recovering with a 15% YoY revenue increase after consecutive contractions since 4Q23. Gross margin improved to 49.2% in 3Q25 (vs. 45.5% in 3Q24 and 48% in 2Q25). Management indicated further efficiency opportunities but warned that restructuring costs will increase in 4Q25. Dividend prospects include a 2025 dividend plus dividends from the ice-cream business divestiture, estimated at about 210 rupiah per share, yielding roughly 9% based on the closing price of 2,260 rupiah on Thursday (23/10). The ice-cream business contributed ~2.8 trillion rupiah in revenue (10% of total) and ~270 billion rupiah in net profit (8% of total) during 9M25. Following the 3Q25 results, UNVR rose 9.2% on Thursday (23/10).

tickerNews.title: HMSP Purchases Rp500 Billion Patriot Bond from Danantara
tickerNews.content: Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna (HMSP) announced that the company has purchased two series of long-term patriot bonds from Danantara totaling 500 billion rupiah. The bonds have tenors of 5 years and 7 years with an annual coupon of 2% each. The investment represents 1.76% of HMSP's equity.

tickerNews.title: AKRA Reports 3Q25 Net Profit 470 Billion Rupiah (+1% YoY)
tickerNews.content: AKR Corporindo recorded net profit of 470 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (+1% YoY, -24% QoQ). The 9M25 net profit reached 1.65 trillion rupiah (+12% YoY), matching 65% of the 2025 consensus estimate and within the management guidance range of 63-69%. Pre-tax profit (PBT) from the 'trade and distribution' segment, which contributed about 70% of total PBT in 2024, declined 2% YoY and 13% QoQ in 3Q25, but grew 18% YoY over 9M25. PBT from the 'industrial estate' segment was 79 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (+154% YoY, -66% QoQ) despite weak land sales of 52 billion rupiah (-90% QoQ, -70% YoY), offset by electricity and utility sales of 214 billion rupiah (+69% QoQ, +112% YoY).

tickerNews.title: NSSS Reports 3Q25 Net Profit 240 Billion Rupiah (+112% YoY)
tickerNews.content: Nusantara Sawit Sejahtera (NSSS) recorded net profit of 240 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (+112% YoY, +58% QoQ). The 9M25 net profit reached 554 billion rupiah (+309% YoY). Revenue in 3Q25 rose to 545 billion rupiah (+41% YoY, +16% QoQ), and 9M25 revenue increased 56% YoY to 1.5 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: ADHI Records 3Q25 Net Loss 3.1 Billion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Adhi Karya (ADHI) posted a net loss of 3.1 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (compared with a net profit of 56 billion rupiah in 3Q24 and 7.2 billion rupiah in 2Q25). The 9M25 net profit amounted to 4.4 billion rupiah, a 94% YoY decline. Revenue in 3Q25 fell to 1.8 trillion rupiah (-47% YoY, -13% QoQ), leading to a 38% YoY drop in 9M25 revenue to 5.7 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: BUKA Plans Rp420.8 Billion Share Buyback (Oct 24 2025 - Jan 23 2026)
tickerNews.content: Bukalapak (BUKA) intends to continue its share buyback program with a fund allocation of approximately 420.8 billion rupiah for the period 24 October 2025 to 23 January 2026. The corporate action does not require a shareholders' meeting, following the OJK's relaxation to support market stability. The allocation represents the remaining funds from previous buyback periods (7 July-6 October 2025 and 26 March-25 June 2025).

tickerNews.title: ARNA Plans Rp50 Billion Share Buyback (Oct 24 2025 - Jan 23 2026)
tickerNews.content: Arwana Citramulia (ARNA) plans to execute a share buyback with a fund allocation of up to 50 billion rupiah for the period 24 October 2025 to 23 January 2026. The corporate action does not require a shareholders' meeting, following the OJK's relaxation to support market stability.

tickerNews.title: HEAL Appoints Yulisar Khiat as President Director
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Medikaloka Hermina (HEAL) approved on Thursday (23/10) the appointment of Yulisar Khiat as President Director, replacing Hasmoro. Previously, Yulisar served as the company's Chief Financial Officer. Hasmoro was appointed as President Commissioner, with Binsar Parasian Simorangkir as Vice President Commissioner and Kumala Insiwi Suryo as Independent Commissioner.

tickerNews.title: JECC Announces Rp29.5 Billion Share Buyback (Oct 23 - Dec 5 2025)
tickerNews.content: Jembo Cable Company (JECC) plans a share buyback of approximately 29.5 billion rupiah for the period 23 October to 5 December 2025. The buyback will repurchase all shares held by Fujikura Asia Limited, representing about 6.49% of JECC's total shares. The corporate action does not require a shareholders' meeting and will be carried out through the negotiation market in accordance with POJK No. 29/2023.

tickerNews.title: IMPC Announces Partnership for Plastic Waste Processing Project
tickerNews.content: Impack Pratama Industri (IMPC), through its subsidiary PT Sirkular Karya Indonesia, announced a collaboration with PT Marubeni Indonesia and PT DNP Indonesia to develop a plastic waste processing project that will convert plastic waste into environmentally friendly building materials. The collected plastic waste from PT DNP Indonesia's production facilities will be processed by PT Sirkular Karya Indonesia into various building material products for nationwide distribution.
